main_definition: A scout is a person who explores an area or performs reconnaissance, often with the purpose of gathering information about a terrain, enemy forces, or resources.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An individual who gathers information for military purposes
meanings_and_examples.example: The scout reported back to his commanders about enemy positions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A participant in a sports competition, typically focusing on speed and agility
meanings_and_examples.example: During the track meet, young athletes showcased their skills as fast-paced scouts.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An individual who joins an organized group to participate in specific activities or events
meanings_and_examples.example: The scout joined a hiking trip and learned about nature along the way.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person employed by a company, typically for low-paying jobs involving physical labor
meanings_and_examples.example: As a child, I used to work as a newspaper delivery scout in my neighborhood.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The first part of a military operation aimed at collecting information and identifying objectives
meanings_and_examples.example: Before launching the full-scale attack, the army conducted several scout missions to assess enemy defenses.
